treatment.description: Plants becoming terrestrial. Rootstock nearly globose, 2-lobed. Leaves deciduous, dull green, pale to dark brown toward base, spirally arranged, less than 30 cm, pliant, gradually tapering to tip. Velum covering less than 1/3 of sporangium. Sporangium wall brown-streaked to completely brown. Megaspores white, 400--480 μm diam., boldly tuberculate to rugulate with cristate, occasionally branched to anastomosing ridges; girdle obscure. Microspores light brown in mass, 27--33 μm, spinulose. 2n = 22, 44.
treatment.discussion: Short plants with 15 to 50 leaves and a tendency toward lower and more open megaspore ornamentation have been called Isoëtes virginica var. piedmontana Pfeiffer.
treatment.phenology: Spores mature late in spring-early summer
treatment.habitat: Mud flats and depressions on and around granite outcrops
